p: Passive epidemiological surveillance can be complemented by active surveillance. A variety of active surveillance strategies exists, such as syndromic surveillance, sentinel surveillance, and active case finding. Syndromic surveillance is the monitoring of indicators for the early detection of outbreaks, such as school/work absenteeism, medication sales, and internet-based health inquiries. Sentinel surveillance is conducted through selected reporting units with a high probability of seeing dengue cases, such as hospitals and airports, which are entrusted to identify and notify the cases. Active case finding is the active research of cases in hospitals and healthcare units [ 20].
